es.unican.ctr.marte2mast.files
Class ActivityFunctions

java.lang.Object
  es.unican.ctr.marte2mast.files.ActivityFunctions

public class ActivityFunctions
extends java.lang.Object

This class contains a series of methods used to extract the relevant data from the model's activity diagrams and generate the MAST's text for operations and transactions.

Two of the methods are called from Acceleo's marte2mast.mtl template: extractActivityData and getOperationsTransactionsText

public ActivityFunctions()
Method Detail

extractContextInfo

public static void extractContextInfo(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element theContext)
Extracts the context data from the "SaAnalysisContext" stereotyped element. If the invoke option, for the mast tool, is set to false, Mast.mOpenGmast will be set to false, in any other case it will be set to true.

we also check for a mode text here.

Parameters:
theContext - "SaAnalysisContext" stereotyped element

createInternalEventText

public static java.lang.String createInternalEventText(java.lang.String name)
Creates a new name for the internal event from the old one. Right now it outputs the input name, so maybe this isn't needed.

Parameters:
name - the original name

createDummyOperation

public static java.lang.String createDummyOperation()
Creates a MAST simple operation with execution times set to 0.0 called DummyOperation.

Returns:
the String "DummyOperation"

treeHasConcurRes

public static boolean treeHasConcurRes(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.NamedElement root,
                                       boolean checkThisOne)
Recursive method that checks if a given element ("SaStep" stereotyped), or any of its 'children' (in the subUsage property or an associated Activity) has a value set for the concuRes property of the stereotype.

Parameters:
root - the initial element
checkThisOne - true if you want to check the root element or only its 'children'
Returns:
true if an element with concurRes was found, false if not

treeHasExecTime

public static boolean treeHasExecTime(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.NamedElement root,
                                      boolean checkThisOne)
Recursive method that checks if a given element ("SaStep" stereotyped), or any of its 'children' (in the subUsage property or an associated Activity) has a value set for the execTime property of the stereotype.

Parameters:
root - the initial element
checkThisOne - true if you want to check the root element or only its 'children'
Returns:
true if an element with execTime was found, false if not

closeEventHandler

public static void closeEventHandler()
Adds all the data left to complete the current event handler (MAST) stored in 'mEventHandler' and adds it to the 'mEventHandlerList' list of event handlers. A new event handler structure is then created (in 'mEventHandler').

When a handler is closed, a new composite operation (MAST) is created, containing all the operations stored in the list 'mEventHandlerOperationList' (the list is then cleared for later use). This list is filled by 'extractStepData'.

Every time the current thread changes, or we reach the end of the transaction, we have to call this method to complete and store the opened handler.

getSimpleOperationText

public static java.lang.String getSimpleOperationText(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.NamedElement theElement)
Given an element ('SaStep' stereotyped), it returns the corresponding text for a simple operation (MAST). It also stores the name of the operation in a list called 'mSimpleOperationsNames' in order to not repeating operations in the MAST files when they are used more than once.

Parameters:
theElement - the UML element
Returns:
the simple operation's text in MAST format

getCompositeOperationText

public static java.lang.String getCompositeOperationText(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.NamedElement theElement,
                                                         java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> simpleOperations)
Given an element ('SaStep stereotyped) and a vector containing the names of the operations it contains, it returns the corresponding text for a composite operation (MAST).

Parameters:
theElement - the UML element
simpleOperations - a vector containing the names of the operations it contains
Returns:
the composite operation's text in MAST format

getEnclosingOperationText

public static java.lang.String getEnclosingOperationText(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.NamedElement theElement,
                                                         java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> simpleOperations)
Given an element ('SaStep stereotyped) and a vector containing the names of the operations it contains, it returns the corresponding text for an enclosing operation (MAST).

Parameters:
theElement - the UML element
simpleOperations - a vector containing the names of the operations it contains
Returns:
the enclosing operation's text in MAST format

getExternalEventText

public static java.lang.String getExternalEventText(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element elt)
Given an element ('GaWorkloadEvent' stereotyped) containing valid Arrival Pattern data (MARTE), it returns the text for an external event (MAST)

Parameters:
elt - an element ('GaWorkloadEvent' stereotyped)
Returns:
the external event's text in MAST format

getInternalEventsText

public static java.lang.String getInternalEventsText(java.util.Vector<java.lang.String> internalEventList,
                                                     org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Constraint theConstraint,
                                                     org.eclipse.uml2.uml.NamedElement gaWorkloadEvent)
Returns the text for all the internal events stored in the list 'internalEventList'. The parameter 'theConstraint' is used to created the global timing requirements for the last event and the parameter 'gaWorkloadEvent' is used to get the name of the external event.

Called from 'extractActivityData'.

Parameters:
internalEventList - a list of all the internal events
theConstraint - a constraint element ('GaLatencyObs' stereotyped) containing the global timing requirements' data
gaWorkloadEvent - an element ('GaWorkloadEvent' stereotyped) corresponding to the external event
Returns:
the text for all the internal events in MAST format

getActivityFromOperation

public static org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element getActivityFromOperation(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.NamedElement theElement)
Given an element (instance of Operation) this method returns the Activity element associated to it, if exists.

Parameters:
theElement - UML Element (Operation)
Returns:
the Activity element associated to the operation, if exists.

generateOperations

public static void generateOperations(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.NamedElement rootElement)
Called from extractStepData when it reaches an operation (SaStep) with NO subUsages with concurRes or inner activities with concurRes. This method calls itself recursively till there are no more operations to add. Simple operations are added to the mSimpleOperationsText static member variable, composite operations to mCompositeOperationsText and enclosing operations to mEnclosingOperationsText.

Parameters:
rootElement - UML Element ("SaStep" stereotyped)

extractStepData

public static boolean extractStepData(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.NamedElement theElement,
                                      java.lang.String parentThread)
Extracts the relevant data from a given element ("SaStep" stereotyped). This method is called from each of the elements on the list created by extractActivityElements and calls itself recursively for each of its valid ("SaStep" stereotyped) children elements (from an Activity if it has one associated or from its subUsage list).

The parentThread parameter is used to keep track of the caller element's concuRes, which is important to generate the event handlers (MAST).

Parameters:
theElement - UML Element (should be an Activity)
parentThread - concuRes of the parent element.
Returns:
a vector containing the relevant elements of the Activity diagram in order

extractActivityElements

public static java.util.Vector<org.eclipse.uml2.uml.NamedElement> extractActivityElements(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element anElement)
Extracts an vector containing the relevant elements ("SaStep" stereotyped) of the Activity diagram in order. Given an InitailNode ("GaWorkloadEvent" stereotyped) it follows the diagram elements until it reaches the end. i.e. ControlFlow->ActivityNode->ControlFlow->ActivityNode->...->ActivityNode->-|

Parameters:
anElement - UML Element (should be an Activity)
Returns:
a vector containing the relevant elements of the Activity diagram in order

extractActivityData

public static void extractActivityData(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element elt)
Static method called from Acceleo's marte2mast.mtl template for every Activity with the stereotype "SaEndtoEndFlow" (also, the Activity has to be owned by an element with the stereotype "SaAnalysisContext").

Uses other methods from this class, like extractActivityElements, extractStepData, closeEventHandler, getExternalEventText ... to generate the text for this transaction.

Parameters:
elt - should be a UML Activity with the restrictions above described

getOperationsTransactionsText

public static java.lang.Object getOperationsTransactionsText(org.eclipse.uml2.uml.Element elt)
Static method called from Acceleo's marte2mast.mtl template, after extracting the data from all the activities, to return the text describing the MAST operations and transactions.

Parameters:
elt - UML Element from which the method is called in Acceleo
Returns:
the text describing the MAST operations and transactions
